sen.j: 北条 泰家（ほうじょう やすいえ、？ - 1335年（建武 (日本)2年）頃？）は鎌倉時代から南北朝時代 (日本)にかけての北条氏の一族。
sen.e: Yasuie HOJYO (? - 1335) was from the Hojyo family which existed in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Yasuie HOJYO (? - 1335) was from the Hojyo family which existed in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Yasuie HOJO (? - 1335) was from the Hojo family which existed in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 父は鎌倉幕府の第9代執権・北条貞時。
sen.e: His father was Sadatoki HOJYO, the 9th shogunal regent of the Kamakura shogunate.
His father was Sadatoki HOJYO, the 9th shogunal regent of the Kamakura shogunate.
His father was Sadatoki HOJO, the 9th shogunal regent of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 母は安達泰宗（または安達時顕）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Yasumune ADACHI (or Tokiaki ADACHI).
His mother was a daughter of Yasumune ADACHI (or Tokiaki ADACHI).
His mother was a daughter of Yasumune ADACHI (or Tokiaki ADACHI).

sen.j: 第14代執権・北条高時の弟に当たる。
sen.e: He was the brother of Takatoki HOJYO, the 14th shogunal regent.
He was the brother of Takatoki HOJYO, the 14th shogunal regent.
He was the brother of Takatoki HOJO, the fourteenth shogunal regent.
His official rank was Junior Fifth-low Court Rank.
His official rank was Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade
sen.cmt: As per term list of July 31st
sen.e: His official rank was Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade
He was Sakon'no-jyo, a captain of the Imperial Guard of the Left.
He was Sakon'no-jyo, a captain of the Imperial Guard of the Left.
He was Sakon'no-jyo, a captain of the Imperial Guard of the Left.

sen.j: はじめ、相模四郎時利と号した。
sen.e: He identified himself as Sagami-Shiro Tokitoshi.
He identified himself as Sagami-Shiro Tokitoshi.
He called himself Sagami-Shiro Tokitoshi.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現にしました。

sen.j: 1326年、兄の高時が執権職を退いたとき、その後を継ごうとしたが、長崎高資の反対にあって実現しなかった。
sen.e: In 1326, he was going to take over the position of shogunal regent when his elder brother Takatoki resigned the post; however, he was unable to take office because of opposition by Takasuke NAGASAKI.
In 1326, he was going to take over the position of shogunal regent when his elder brother Takatoki resigned the post, but was unable to take office due to opposition from Takasuke NAGASAKI.
sen.cmt: Reworked to get rid of colon.
sen.e: In 1326, he was going to take over the position of shogunal regent when his elder brother Takatoki resigned the post, but was unable to take office due to opposition from Takasuke NAGASAKI.

sen.j: ちなみに兄の後を継いで執権となった北条貞顕がわずか10日で執権職を辞任したのは、泰家が貞顕に圧力をかけたからである。
sen.e: Incidentally, Sadaaki HOJYO, who took over the position of shogunal regent after the elder brother, resigned in just 10 days because Yasuie put pressure on Sadaaki.
Incidentally, Sadaaki HOJYO, who took over the position of shogunal regent after the elder brother, resigned in just 10 days because Yasuie put pressure on Sadaaki.
Incidentally, Sadaaki HOJO, who took over the position of shogunal regent after his elder brother, resigned after just 10 days because Yasuie put pressure on Sadaaki.
sen.cmt: 冠詞。” the elder brother”→” his elder brother” cmt2: 前置詞間違い: “in just”-> “after just”

sen.j: 1333年、新田義貞が軍勢を率いて鎌倉に侵攻してきたとき、幕府軍を率いてこれを迎撃し、一時は勝利を収めたが、その勝利で油断して新田軍に大敗を喫した。
sen.e: He led the army of shogunate when Yoshisada NITTA invaded Kamakura with his army in 1333 and won for a while; however, the army got careless after the victory, they took a pounding from the army of Nitta.

He led the army of shogunate against Yoshisada NITTA who invaded Kamakura with his army in 1333 and won a short term victory, but the army of the shogunate got careless after their victory and were subsequently heavily defeated by Nitta's army.
sen.cmt: Reworked to make the sentence more natural.
sen.e: He led the army of the shogunate against Yoshisada NITTA who invaded Kamakura with his army in 1333 and won a short term victory, but the army of the bakufu became careless after their victory and were subsequently heavily defeated by Nitta's army.
sen.cmt: 構文。 定冠詞が“shogunate”.の前で必要です。 →"the shogunate" cmt2: 慣用的過ぎる “got careless”. -> “became careless”."shogunage" -> "bakufu" に変更しました。

sen.j: 幕府滅亡時には兄の高時と行動を共にせず、兄の遺児である北条時行を逃がした後、自身も陸奥国へと落ち延びている。
sen.e: He didn't act with Takatoki the elder brother at the time of the downfall of the shogunate, and withdrew to the Province of Mutsu after he released Tokiyuki HOJYO, the son of the late elder brother.
Yausie did not join his elder brother, Takatoki, at the fall of the shogunate, and after releasing Tokiyuki HOJYO, his elder brother's son, withdrew to Mutsu Province.
Yasuie did not join his elder brother, Takatoki, at the fall of the bakufu, and after releasing Tokiyuki HOJO, his elder brother's son, withdrew to Mutsu Province.
sen.cmt: Yausie→Yasuie, HOJYO→HOJO"shogunate" -> "bakufu" に変更しました。

sen.j: その後、京都に上洛して旧知の仲にあった西園寺公宗の屋敷に潜伏し、1335年6月に公宗と共に後醍醐天皇暗殺や北条氏残党による幕府再挙を図って挙兵しようと計画を企んだが、事前に計画が露見して公宗は殺されてしまった。
sen.e: He went to Kyoto and hid in the residence of Kimmune SAIONJI who had known each other, and they plotted an assassination of Emperor Go-Daigo or taking up of arms to try to reorganize the shogunate by the remnants of the Hojyo clan in June 1335; however, the plot was exposed beforehand and Kimmune was killed.

He went to Kyoto and hid in the residence of Kimmune SAIONJI who was an old ally, and they plotted to assassinate Emperor Go-Daigo and take up of arms to reinstate the shogunate with the remnants of the Hojyo clan in June 1335, but the plot was exposed before they could act and Kimmune was killed.
sen.cmt: Reworked sentence to read more fluently.
sen.e: He went to Kyoto and hid in the residence of Kimmune SAIONJI who was an old ally, and they plotted to assassinate the Emperor Godaigo and take up arms to reinstate the shogunate with the remnants of the Hojo clan in June 1335, but the plot was exposed before they could act and Kimmune was killed.
sen.cmt: 慣用句間違い。 “take up of arms”.. -> “take up arms”."the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: ただし、泰家はこのとき、追手の追跡から逃れている。
sen.e: Nonetheless, Yasuie escaped pursuit of the chaser at that time.
Yasuie, however, managed to escaped the clutches of those who pursued him.
sen.cmt: "nonetheless" was unnatural. Also reworked sentence for better fluency.
sen.e: Yasuie, however, managed to escaped the clutches of those who pursued him.

sen.j: その後、甥の時行と共に信濃国で挙兵したと言われているが、その後の消息は不明。
sen.e: It was said he took up arms with Tokiyuki, his nephew, in the Province of Shinano; however, he was never heard of again after that.
It was said that he subsequently took up arms with Tokiyuki, his nephew, in the Shinano Province, but he was never heard of again.
sen.cmt: Changed "Province of Shinano" to "Shinano province" as per the term list of July 31st.
sen.e: It was said that he subsequently took up arms with Tokiyuki, his nephew, in Shinano Province, but he was never heard of again.
sen.cmt: the Shinano Province の定冠詞 the 不要

sen.j: 一説には、1335年末に野盗によって殺害されたとも言われているが、『太平記』においても1335年の記述を最後に登場することが無いので、恐らくはこの前後に死んだものと思われる。
sen.e: It is said that he was killed by robbers at the end of 1335, and it is likely around that time when he was dead because he was not mentioned in "Taihei-ki", Chronicle of the Great Peace, after the description in 1335.
Another view is that he was killed by robbers at the end of 1335, and it is likely that he died around that time because after 1335 he is not mentioned in "Taihei-ki", Chronicle of the Great Peace.
sen.cmt: "It is said" has already been used above. I changed this to "another view is" for a better lead in from the preceding sentence.
sen.e: Another view is that he was killed by robbers at the end of 1335, and it is likely that he died around that time because after 1335 he is not mentioned in "Taihei-ki", Chronicle of the Great Peace.
